FAQ Question 1: How can I apply for research funding?
FAQ Answer 1: Research funding applications are processed through our application portal. Researchers must first review current funding opportunities on our website, then prepare a proposal according to the specified guidelines. Applications are reviewed quarterly by our scientific committee.
FAQ Question 2: Do you offer internships for students?
FAQ Answer 2: Yes, we offer internships for undergraduate and graduate students in various scientific disciplines. Internship opportunities are posted on our careers page three times a year (spring, summer, and fall). We also have a year-round research fellowship program for PhD candidates.
FAQ Question 3: How can I access research articles published by your scientists?
FAQ Answer 3: All research articles published by ANRSI scientists are available through our open-access digital repository. You can search by author, subject, or publication date. For specialized research that may have access restrictions, please contact the corresponding author directly.
FAQ Question 4: Can I visit your research facilities?
FAQ Answer 4: We organize public tours of our facilities on the first Friday of each month. For educational institutions, we offer specialized guided tours by appointment. Some sensitive research areas have restricted access, but our visitor center features interactive exhibits showcasing our work.
FAQ Question 5: How can I collaborate with your researchers?
FAQ Answer 5: We welcome collaboration proposals from academic institutions, industry partners, and independent researchers. Please submit a brief overview of your proposed collaboration through our Partnerships department, including your research interests, objectives, and potential synergies with our ongoing work.
FAQ Answer 6: ANRSI offers several funding programs: Temkin (Empowerment), Temeyouz (Excellence), Tethmin (Valorization), and TEMM (Local Development). Each program has its own criteria and deadlines. Check our Programs page for more details.
